title: Introducing: Tenlons Fort
body:
Perhaps not as fitting for an “Introducing” article as others, Austin’s **Tenlons Fort** aka Jack Gibson has been around for well over ten years now, gathering somewhat of a cult following.

Having donated 50% of proceedings from their last record, **_Shelters_**, to Tenlons Fort Shelters Fund, a charity helping homeless people in LA, Austin and further afield. His new self-titled record is one of this years understated beauties, compelling, emotionally touching songwriting at its utmost pure and desirable of repeated listens. With elements of folk-pop a la **Fleetwood Mac** or **Damien Jurado**, mixed alongside more upbeat influences (dare I say **Vampire Weekend**), it’s a truly gorgeous listen. Check out Tenlons Fort below, including my highlight _Disaster Speaks_ and _Your Hand Is A Song_, which is scheduled to have an official release later in the year.
